lines.text: Snow is like a wide sea. One could go out and be lost in it, and forget the world... and oneself.
Must we live for the dead?
For the great dead, yes, Your Majesty.
One can feel nostalgia for places one has never seen.
I have *imagined* happiness. But happiness you *cannot* imagine. Happiness you must feel! Joy, you must feel!
There's a mystery in you.
Is there not in every human being?
Great love...
Don't you believe in it's possibility?

In it's possibility - yes. But not in its existence. A great love, perfect love, is an illusion. It is the golden fable of which we all dream. But in ordinary life it doesn't happen. In ordinary life one must be content with less.
I have been memorizing this room. In the future, in my memory, I shall live a great deal in this room.
There are rumors that your Majesty is planning a foreign marriage.
They are baseless.
But your Majesty, you cannot die an old maid.
I have no intention to, Chancellor. I shall die a bachelor!
I am your destiny, Christina.
Are you? I long to escape my destiny.
You will long to return to it.

It's all a question of climate. You cannot serenade a woman in a snowstorm. All the graces in the art of love - elaborate approches that will make the game amusing - can only be practiced in those countries that quiver in the heat of the sun.
You are very pretty, Elsa. Are you also good?
When I do not like a man, yes.
That's a true virtue.
The basis of all morality in a sentence.
I have quite a collection of royal portraits. My suitors usually come in oil. And I've kept them - because I love a good painting.

[on the street protests about her private life]
Evidently my people, who are said to love me, do not wish me to be happy.

[in disguise]
I'll tell you the truth. Well, gentlemen, I have the truth as the Queen has had 12 lovers this past year. A proud dozen!
Long live the Queen!
Of course. It has to be. I felt it. I felt it! The presence. Oh, life is so gloriously improbable.
It is still snowing my lord.
Good!
This is how the Lord must have felt when he beheld the finished world with all His creatures breathing... living.

Spoils. Glory. Flags and trumpets. What is behind these high sounding words ? Death and destruction. Triumphals of crippled men. Sweden victorious in a ravaged Europe. An island in a dead sea. I tell you, I want no more of it! I want for my people, security and happiness. I want to cultivate the arts of peace. The arts of life! I want peace and peace I will have!
Any lie will find believers as long as you tell it with force enough.
